name: Coryphæus
short_description:
Coryphæus is a program that automates some of the administrative work involved in dealing a round of the game of Dixonary. Dixonary is an online version of the parlour game otherwise called Balderdash! or Fictionary. This game began in the Tapcis forum on CompuServe on 4 July 1989. Having just celebrated its silver jubilee, it is now, at least according to Wikipedia, the world's longest-running online game, and is still going strong.
This project is version 5 of Coryphæus. Version 1 first appeared in 1996 for 16-bit Windows, and it was continuously maintained for Windows platforms through 4 major versions until 2012, when the author finally gave up the struggle of trying to keep a legacy Delphi application current in a changing world.
Version 5 is a complete cross-platform rewrite. It retains much of the user interface of earlier versions, but has been rewritten from the ground up, in a current language, and with all the underlying technology rethought.
Pronounce it co-RIF-ee-us.
summary: Coryphæus automates the admin involved in dealing a round of Dixonary
